decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering threats with spells like Mana Leak and Spell Pierce, while also removing creatures with cards like Journey to Nowhere and Condemn. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Wall of Omens and Gideon Jura before winning the game with powerful finishers like Baneslayer Angel and Sun Titan. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Jace Beleren and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and control. It utilizes lands like Celestial Colonnade and Tectonic Edge for mana fixing and control.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up quickly with mana-generating creatures and spells to be able to play high-cost Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, Ulamog, and Kozilek. The deck also includes cards like Primeval Titan and Wurmcoil Engine for additional threats and board presence. The Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin provide mana acceleration specifically for Eldrazi creatures. The inclusion of cards like Summoning Trap allows for the potential to cheat these creatures into play for free, overwhelming the opponent and taking control of the game.

This deck focuses on using powerful control elements to slow down the opponent while ramping up mana production to play high-cost spells and creatures. The deck includes a mix of counterspells, card draw engines, and versatile threats to control the pace of the game. The key strategy is to generate a significant advantage in resources and tempo, utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Frost Titan to dominate the battlefield and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and overwhelming board presence.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also incorporates cards like Frost Titan and Wurmcoil Engine to provide additional threats and board presence. The deck aims to interact with the opponent's spells and creatures, disrupt their game plan, and ultimately win through card advantage and powerful late-game plays. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and include utility lands like Tectonic Edge for additional disruption.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive vampire creatures while utilizing burn spells and removal to maintain board control. It also includes some card draw and temporary creature theft to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent through consistent damage output and removal of threats, ultimately leading to a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. Utilizing high-powered creatures like Inferno Titan and Kargan Dragonlord, along with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to finish the game quickly by putting pressure on the opponent's life total. With mana acceleration from cards like Koth of the Hammer and Teetering Peaks, the deck can put out threats early and consistently to maintain its aggressive tempo and secure a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly through cards like Cultivate, Harrow, Khalni Heart Expedition, and Oracle of Mul Daya, in order to cast powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar. By utilizing Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage to the opponent's creatures and face. The deck also includes cards like Koth of the Hammer and Summoning Trap to further support its game plan of ramping into powerful threats and controlling the game.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize fast and aggressive vampire creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Bloodghast, Kalastria Highborn, and Vampire Lacerator, the deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total while also using sacrifice effects like Bloodthrone Vampire and Pawn of Ulamog for additional benefits. The deck also includes removal spells like Vendetta to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck seeks to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence through aggressive landfall triggers and efficient creatures. By utilizing cards that benefit from playing lands and putting pressure on the opponent early in the game, it aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. With a mix of powerful creatures, removal spells, and land ramp, the deck aims to be fast and consistent in its aggressive strategy, keeping the opponent on the back foot and unable to mount a successful defense.

The deck revolves around ramping up mana quickly through cards like Joraga Treespeaker and Overgrown Battlement to quickly play massive Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre. Control elements such as All Is Dust and Eldrazi Temple are used to disrupt the opponent's strategy while still maintaining a strong board presence. The deck also includes cards like Cultivate and Explore to ensure consistent land drops and card advantage. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and control the game through disruptive spells.

The focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Joraga Treespeaker, Overgrown Battlement, and Cultivate, in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre. The deck also includes cards like Acidic Slime and Mold Shambler to control the opponent's board, while utilizing cards like Summoning Trap to cheat out Eldrazi creatures for extra value. The mana base includes Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to further support the Eldrazi theme, making it a formidable control deck with big threats.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board of powerful Elf creatures and using their synergy to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays. By ramping up mana with cards like Arbor Elf and Llanowar Elves, and utilizing powerful cards like Ezuri, Renegade Leader and Vengevine, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence. The inclusion of Eldrazi Monument provides protection and a powerful buff for the Elves, while Tectonic Edge helps disrupt the opponent's mana base. The overall strategy of the deck is to swarm the opponent with a flurry of Elves and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on using Pyromancer Ascension to duplicate powerful spells, enabling strong combo plays and overwhelming the opponent. It includes a mix of burn spells, card draw, counterspells, and deck filtering to support the combo strategy. Jace Beleren provides additional card advantage, while lands like Scalding Tarn and Misty Rainforest ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the key strategy is to quickly set up Pyromancer Ascension and then generate powerful spell combinations to control the game and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling powerful equipment to equip to creatures, using cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Quest for the Holy Relic. By deploying low-cost creatures like Ornithopter and Memnite, the deck aims to swarm the board early and overwhelm the opponent with efficient attackers like Kor Firewalker and Glint Hawk. With a mix of evasive threats and equipment that can generate card advantage and removal, the deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this RUG Control deck is to maintain control of the board through strong creatures and powerful spells. By leveraging cards like Frost Titan, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Mana Leak, the deck aims to disrupt opponent strategies while generating card advantage. The deck also utilizes ramp and card selection with Lotus Cobra, Oracle of Mul Daya, and Preordain to ensure consistent mana production and draw. With a mix of creature threats and versatile spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 setting.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive vampire creatures. By utilizing cards such as Bloodghast and Kalastria Highborn, the deck aims to maintain a constant offensive pressure. Additionally, the deck includes various sacrifice outlets like Viscera Seer and Bloodthrone Vampire to generate additional value from sacrificing creatures. Blade of the Bloodchief can also help boost the power of the vampires on the battlefield. Overall, the strategy is to efficiently attack and capitalize on sacrificing creatures to maintain board advantage and secure victory.
